task.title: Specify the Data Processing Function
task.shortdesc: To associate a DPF with a data source, you upload the DPF archive onto the Data Processing Function screen of the Data Sources page.

p.xref: Tell me about DPFs and DPF archives.

context.p: To associate a DPF with a data source:

step.cmd: From the Data Policy screen of the Data Sources page, click the Data Processing Function tab.
step.info: The Data Processing Function screen opens. When you first define a data source, no Data Processing Function (DPF) is associated with it.

step.cmd: Click the Add a DPF button.
step.info: The Apply DPF for this Datasource screen opens.

step.cmd: Choose to use either a System DPF or a Custom DPF.

choices.choice: If you choose System DPF, select which PHEMI system DPF you want to use from the drop-down menu. Choose between a DPF for processing Variant Call Format (VCF) data and a DPF for processing Microsoft Excel workbook data. Once the system DPF is selected, click the Apply System DPF button to apply the DPF.

If you choose Custom DPF, click the Select File button, navigate to the DPF archive and double-click the ZIP file. Or, drag and drop the DPF archive from your file manager oto the target area on the screen.Click the Apply Custom DPF button to upload the ZIP file and apply the DPF.
